newsitem.title: USA: McVeigh trial resumes with FBI fingerprint expert.
newsitem.headline: McVeigh trial resumes with FBI fingerprint expert.

text.p: DENVER, April 29 (Reuter ) - The trial of Timothy McVeigh resumed Tuesday with testimony from an FBI agent who took fingerprints from the accused Oklahoma City bomber after his arrest.

Prosecutors are using the testimony of FBI fingerprint specialist Louis Hupp, who explained to the anonymous federal jury how fingerprint identifications are made, to present some of their physical evidence against McVeigh.
Later in the day, prosecutors are expected to show jurors the twisted rear axle of the rented Ryder truck used in the bombing that provided a key clue in their investigation.
An identification number was found on the axle and led authorities to a truck rental agency in Junction City, Kansas.

There, prosecutors say, McVeigh, using an assumed name, rented the truck to carry the powerful bomb that blew up the Alfred P. Murrah federal building in Oklahoma City on April 19, 1995. The blast killed 168 people.
McVeigh has pleaded not guilty and faces the death penalty if convicted.
